_header: All things contrived by mans reason
Note:
Ringler Jr. (1988)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse Printed 1476-1558. London: Mansell, 1988, TP 115.
_description: John Skelton, ‘Magnyfycence’ — 2567 lines in varied stanzas

VandADyce44.First Lines:
Al thyngys contryvyd by mannys reasonThe world envyronnyd of hygh
                    and low estate…
VandADyce44.Last Lines:
…Redresse. And ye that haue harde this dysporte and
                    gameIhesus preserue you from endlesse wo and shameA M E N
VandADyce44.Attributed Title:
Magnyfycence, / A Goodly Interlude and a Me / ry devysed and made by
                    mayster Skelton poet / laureate late de / ceaseyd. (p. 1)
